For the folks who aren't a fan of the new forum update:  Totally understandable.  I'm not a big fan, myself.  ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") 

A little bit of context may be helpful in understand how and why the change happened:

- **It wasn't anyone at Squad or T2 who changed the look.**  The forum software is produced by a completely separate company, and they're the ones who design it and update it.  Squad/T2 are just customers.
- **It wasn't because the folks at Squad/T2 particularly *<u>wanted</u>* to change the look.**  It was just an update to a newer version of the forum software, that's all.  The changes to the "look" just came along for the ride.
- **No, it's not really an option not to update to a newer version.**  It's important to keep forum software up to date.  For example, newer versions contain security fixes, and so forth-- it's not okay not to take those.  Yes, it sure would be nice if the company that makes the forum software (which, again, is not Squad or T2) could somehow decouple the "you must take this" update (security etc.) from the "only take this if you want it" stuff (e.g. forum appearance), but that's not how they work.
- **Yes, there are some knobs we can twiddle to adjust *<u>some</u>* things**.  But not all things, and figuring out the "best" settings takes a bit of time, so thank you for your patience in the meantime.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
- **The relevant people running this forum are listening to you, and are doing their best.**  Knob-twiddling has been happening, and folks are genuinely trying to sort things out to avoid needless user pain.

So, with that out of the way, some good news below.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> > > On 7/14/2021 at 1:56 AM, Deddly said: > > > If you need to scroll to see a signature, the signature is too big. > Yes, I agree. Long signatures can be annoying. However, I have been thinking of this for a while. One of the things our forum software is missing is a fully customizable "about me" page. In my mind's eye, it is where folks could share more about themselves, within the scope of the forum guidelines, but without bogging down the signature area. One of the best ways to create a "profile page" where folks can create a brag page. Here's how you could do it: 1. Go to your profile page and activate status updates. Spoiler ![SbwBLr0.png](https://i.imgur.com/SbwBLr0.png) ![RQzR0xR.png](https://i.imgur.com/RQzR0xR.png) 2. Go to the status update you want to use as a static page, sorta like an extension of your profile page or Facebook "about me" section. Click on the date of the status update. Spoiler ![wwbW9CE.png](https://i.imgur.com/wwbW9CE.png) **3. The forum software will now open the status update as a single page with its own URL:** Spoiler ![5j2AOBP.png](https://i.imgur.com/5j2AOBP.png) You can now use that URL in any part of the forum (for example, as a link in your signature), and any other place externally, that allows for URLS to be entered. It will always direct to the singe status update and not to your activity feed. I hope this helps some of you who want to have the "brag page" in the signatures and just cannot confine it to the abbreviated version. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
